metadata.description: Auto-generated application from AI SDLC pipeline

acceptance_criteria.title: Successful Scan and Item Addition
acceptance_criteria.given: I am on the "Add Item to Worklist" screen
acceptance_criteria.when: I scan a valid POS Tracking Number (e.g., TRK-WAR-870506181)
then: the tracking number field is automatically populated.And the system retrieves and displays available item information (description, vendor, etc.).And I can complete any remaining required fields.And I can click "Add to Worklist" to successfully add the item
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Invalid Tracking Number Handling
acceptance_criteria.given: I am on the "Add Item to Worklist" screen
acceptance_criteria.when: I scan an invalid or non-existent POS Tracking Number
then: the system displays an error message "Invalid tracking number - please verify and try again".And the tracking number field is cleared.And I can attempt to scan again
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Duplicate Item Prevention
acceptance_criteria.given: I am on the "Add Item to Worklist" screen
acceptance_criteria.when: I scan a POS Tracking Number that already exists in the current worklist
then: the system displays a warning message "Item already in worklist - added on [date]".And I have the option to "View Existing Item" or "Cancel".And the item is not duplicated in the worklist
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Auto-Population of Item Details
acceptance_criteria.given: I scan a valid POS Tracking Number
acceptance_criteria.when: the system finds matching item information
then: the following fields are automatically populated:.Item ID.Item Description.Department Number.Quantity.Location.Disposition Type.Sell Price.On Hand Inventory.Vendor Name.And I can edit the following fields if needed.Disposition Type.Vendor Name.Quantity.Location
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Manual Entry Fallback
acceptance_criteria.given: I am on the "Add Item to Worklist" screen
acceptance_criteria.when: the barcode scanner is not working or unavailable
then: I can manually type the POS Tracking Number in the field.And the system behaves the same way as if I had scanned the number
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Scan Feedback and User Experience
acceptance_criteria.given: I attempt to scan a POS Tracking Number
acceptance_criteria.when: the scan is successful
then: I hear a confirmation beep (if audio is enabled).And the scanned number appears in the field immediately
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Required Field Validation
acceptance_criteria.given: I have scanned a POS Tracking Number and auto-populated available fields
acceptance_criteria.when: I click "Add to Worklist"
then: the system validates that all required fields are complete.And displays specific error messages for any missing required fields
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Scan POS Tracking Number to Add Item

acceptance_criteria.title: Start Workflow for Salvage Item
acceptance_criteria.given: I have an item in NSI Entry with disposition "Salvage".And the item status is "Approved"
acceptance_criteria.when: I select the item and click "Start Workflow"
then: the system moves the item from "NSI Entry" to "NSI Maintenance".And the item status updates to "In Process".And a workflow log entry is created with timestamp and user ID
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Initiate Salvage Workflow from NSI Entry

acceptance_criteria.title: System Auto-Routing (Background Process)
acceptance_criteria.given: an item has moved to NSI Maintenance with Salvage disposition
acceptance_criteria.when: the system processes the workflow change
then: the system automatically performs a program change to re-route to Return Center.And an RC document is automatically generated in the system.And the item status updates to "Awaiting RC Processing"
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Initiate Salvage Workflow from NSI Entry

acceptance_criteria.title: Workflow Confirmation
acceptance_criteria.given: I have initiated a salvage workflow
acceptance_criteria.when: the system completes the routing
then: the item no longer appears in my NSI Entry worklist.And I can view the updated item status in the system
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Initiate Salvage Workflow from NSI Entry

acceptance_criteria.title: Document Category Selection
acceptance_criteria.given: I have selected pre-sorting requirements for a salvage item
acceptance_criteria.when: I proceed to document generation
then: I see a dropdown field "Document Category" with options such as:.•	Shipping Information.•	Packages.•	Hazmat Container.•	Shipping Documents.•	Labels
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate and Print RC Documentation

acceptance_criteria.title: Document Modal Opening
acceptance_criteria.given: I have selected a document category
acceptance_criteria.when: the system created the RC Document in the background
then: the document model window opens with context.And I can see the generated document
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate and Print RC Documentation

acceptance_criteria.title: RD Document Printing
acceptance_criteria.given: the document modal is open and RD document is displayed
acceptance_criteria.when: I see a “Print” button
then: I can click the button to trigger the document to be printed.And the document contains all relevant item details, tracking numbers, and category information
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate and Print RC Documentation

acceptance_criteria.title: Automatic Master Shipment Generation
acceptance_criteria.given: the RD document has been successfully generated
acceptance_criteria.when: the system completes the RD document creation
then: the system automatically generates a master shipment record.And a unique shipment number is assigned
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: Shipping Documents Available
acceptance_criteria.given: the master shipment has been generated
acceptance_criteria.when: I am in the document modal
then: I see two additional document to select for printing:.•	“BOL" (Bill of Lading).•	"Shipment Label".And I see a tab option to Logline
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: BOL Printing
acceptance_criteria.given: the master shipment is generated
acceptance_criteria.when: I click in the check box to select the “BOL” to print
then: the system sends the BOL to the printer.And the BOL contains shipment number, item details, destination, and required signatures sections
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: Shipment Label Printing
acceptance_criteria.given: the master shipment is generated
acceptance_criteria.when: I click in the check box to select the “Shipment Label” to print
then: the system sends the shipping labels to the printer.And labels include barcode, shipment number, destination address, and handling instructions
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: Logline Documents Printing
acceptance_criteria.given: the master shipment is generated
acceptance_criteria.when: I tab to the “Logline” section in the document modal
then: the system shows the available documents to logline.And I select “Process Logline”                                                                                                                                    And documents include detailed item manifest and tracking information
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: Complete Processing Confirmation
acceptance_criteria.given: I have printed, and loglined all required documents
acceptance_criteria.when: I close the document modal
then: the I am back in the main NSI Maintenance screen.And the shipment appears in the "Outbound Shipments" queue
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Generate Master Shipment and Print Shipping Documents

acceptance_criteria.title: Reverse button on
acceptance_criteria.given: I have an item in NSI Maintenance in "awaiting RC" status.And the item status is not "Processed"
acceptance_criteria.when: I select the item and click "Reverse"
then: the system moves the item from "NSI Maintenance" to "NSI Entry".And the item status updates to "Pending".And a workflow log entry is created with timestamp and user ID
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Reverse a transaction from NSI maintenance screen

acceptance_criteria.title: Allow change disposition and restart the workflow
acceptance_criteria.given: an item has moved to NSI Entry with "Pending" status
acceptance_criteria.when: the user clicks disposition drop down.And user selects a disposition "Destroy".And clicks on "Start workflow"
then: the transaction is moved to "Pending approval" status in the NSI Maintenance.
acceptance_criteria.source_story_title: Reverse a transaction from NSI maintenance screen

terms.definition: Non Salable Inventory - items that cannot be sold through normal retail channels
Return to Vendor - process of returning merchandise back to the supplier
Final determination of what action to take with a non-salable item (Salvage, Destroy, or Return)

workflows: NSI item tracking and status management workflow
Disposition assignment and monitoring workflow for non-salable inventory
Approval and audit workflow for NSI disposition actions
Return to vendor processing workflow for eligible NSI items
Hazmat identification and special handling workflow for hazardous NSI items

definitions.NSI: Non Salable Inventory - items that cannot be sold through normal retail channels
definitions.RTV: Return to Vendor - process of returning merchandise back to the supplier
definitions.Disposition: Final determination of what action to take with a non-salable item (Salvage, Destroy, or Return)
